page.title: 20BIOGRAPHY - FAMOUS PEOPLE
page.content: Liphook has housed quite a few famous people. Flore Thompson used to live in the old Post Office, which is now the Midland Bank. Here she wrote her book Lark Rise to Candleford, which one of the roads in Liphook was named after (Lark Rise). Liphook has been visited by royalty as well. During her reign Queen Victoria and Prince Albert came, and stayed at The Anchor which changed its name to the Royal Anchor. Also Princess Anne used to come here to Stocklands and Downlands, our Riding Stables, for horse shows and other horse events. The actor Boris Karloff, who played parts as Count Dracula, also lived here in Bramshott.
